snippet: In a show of international cooperation that involved Russia and Iraq, Syria was persuaded to stop chemical bomb preparation. But the United States and Europe are not resting easy.
abstract: Officials say remarkable show of international cooperation in Nov 2012 helped curb Syrian government's preparation and deployment of chemical weapons in civil war; concerns remain over Syria's potential use of weapons produced at that time, renewing debate over whether to help Syrian opposition destroy air force that could be used to deploy them.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and DAVID E. SANGER

lead_paragraph: In a show of international cooperation that involved Russia and Iraq, Syria was persuaded to stop chemical bomb preparation. But the United States and Europe are not resting easy.

headline.seo: Chemical Weapons Showdown With Syria Led to Rare Accord
headline.main: Hints of Syrian Chemical Push Set Off Global Effort to Stop It
headline.print_headline: Hints of Syrian Chemical Push Set Off Global Effort to Stop It

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
